Package com.example.project4

Class OrderController

java.lang.Object
com.example.project4.OrderController
public class OrderController extends Object
This class contains methods that replicate a shopping cart that temporarily holds the menu items (donuts or coffee) added so far, but the order has not been placed yet.
Author:
David Fabian, Steven Tan

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderController

      public OrderController()

  • Method Details

    • setMainController

      public void setMainController(StoreFrontController controller)
      Sets the main controller to the StoreFrontController
      Parameters:
      controller - StoreFrontController for which to set this instance's main controller reference to.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the prices' text fields and list view component by setting the default values for each.

    • removeItem

      protected void removeItem()
      Removes the user-selected item from the order. This removal is reflected on the order list view and the values for the subtotal, sales tax, and total are updated.

    • addToStoreOrders

      protected void addToStoreOrders()
      Adds current order to the list of store orders being held in an arraylist. Immediately closes the view if the order has menu items. Notifies the user if the order does not.

    • setOrderedItems

      public void setOrderedItems()
      Sets the order list view and the text field displaying the values for subtotal, sales tax, and total price of the current order being placed. This method is called immediately after setting the Main Controller containing the reference to the current order. Notifies the user if there is no current order.

    • updatePrices

      private void updatePrices()
      Updates the price listed for the current order being viewed/placed by the user. If there is no order, "$0.00" is set as the text.
